default.shortDescription: Extend UI of Office client applications
descriptionParagraphs: Add-in commands are UI elements that extend the Office UI and start actions in your add-in. You can use add-in commands to add a button on the ribbon or an item to a context menu. When users select an add-in command, they initiate actions such as running JavaScript code, or showing a page of the add-in in a task pane. Add-in commands help users find and use your add-in, which can help increase your add-in's adoption and reuse, and improve customer retention.

mediaAssets.alt: Build an Office add-in using modern JavaScript tools and techniques
Increase your productivity with Office Add-ins

items.name: Office Add-in Commands Samples
items.description: Add-in commands enable developers to extend the Office user interface such as the Office Ribbon to create awesome, efficient to use add-ins.

items.name: Simple Add-in Commands Sample
items.description: This sample showcases how to create an add-in with a custom Tab with Ribbon buttons.

items.name: PowerPoint Add-in Commands Sample
items.description: This sample showcases how to create buttons on an existing Office tab.
